articles.headline: At Fox News, Less Attention Paid to Gun Debate Than Elsewhere
articles.snippet: A steady drumbeat of coverage of the gun debate on MSNBC contrasts with that of Fox News Channel, where critics see a lack of interest.
articles.abstract: A steady drumbeat of coverage of the gun debate on MSNBC contrasts with that of Fox News Channel, where critics see a lack of interest.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Obama hadn’t finished his first sentence on Wednesday when the Fox News Channel cut away from his Rose Garden remarks about the Senate’s defeat of a measure that would have expanded background checks for gun buyers.

articles.headline: Noninvasive Cancer Test Is Effective, Study Finds
articles.snippet: In a study involving about 10,000 people, the new test detected 92 percent of the cancers picked up by colonoscopy, according to the company that makes the test.
articles.abstract: In a study involving about 10,000 people, the new test detected 92 percent of the cancers picked up by colonoscopy, according to the company that makes the test.
articles.lead_paragraph: A new noninvasive screening test can detect most cases of colorectal cancer and also many precancerous polyps, potentially helping to sharply reduce the death toll from the disease, according to results of a study released on Thursday.

articles.headline: One Man’s Currency Is Another Man’s Bet
articles.snippet: To the faithful, gold is different from any other commodity. But its precipitous rise since the financial crisis, and its recent sharp fall, sure make it look like one.
articles.abstract: To the faithful, gold is different from any other commodity. But its precipitous rise since the financial crisis, and its recent sharp fall, sure make it look like one.
articles.lead_paragraph: What do you get when you combine evangelical fervor with leverage and rising speculation?

articles.headline: Toyota Said to Plan Lexus Plant in Kentucky
articles.snippet: The announcement, expected Friday, will most likely involve a Lexus line. It would be the first time the Lexus model had been built in America.
articles.abstract: The announcement, expected Friday, will most likely involve a Lexus line. It would be the first time the Lexus model had been built in America.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — The Toyota Motor Corporation is expected to announce on Friday that it will expand production at its plant in Kentucky, most likely adding a line for the luxury Lexus sedan.

articles.headline: Ad About Women’s Self-Image Creates a Sensation
articles.snippet: A video focusing on Dove’s findings that only 4 percent of women consider themselves beautiful has been viewed more than seven million times on YouTube.
articles.abstract: A video focusing on Dove’s findings that only 4 percent of women consider themselves beautiful has been viewed more than seven million times on YouTube.
articles.lead_paragraph: The latest commercial for Dove seems to have gone beyond the skin and touched a nerve.

articles.headline: Polish Museum Repairs a Tie to a Jewish Past
articles.snippet: Among civic leaders in Warsaw, a new Jewish museum is seen as a major step toward recognizing Poland’s Jewish past and recovering from its 20th-century traumas.
articles.abstract: Among civic leaders in Warsaw, a new Jewish museum is seen as a major step toward recognizing Poland’s Jewish past and recovering from its 20th-century traumas.
articles.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — In the entryway of the new Jewish museum here this week, Poland’s chief rabbi unveiled an unusual sculpture: an old, hollowed-out brick engraved with a single Hebrew letter.

articles.headline: After Apple’s Rise, a Bruising Fall
articles.snippet: Shares of Apple were trading for more than $700 last year, but they have tumbled back and analysts are trying to understand why.
articles.abstract: Shares of Apple were trading for more than $700 last year, but they have tumbled back and analysts are trying to understand why.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Nick Wingfield

articles.headline: For Gun Bill Born in Tragedy, a Tangled Path to Defeat
articles.snippet: The failure this week of the Senate’s search for consensus on gun control after the Newtown shooting can be traced to timing, convoluted rules and a counterproductive alliance.
articles.abstract: The failure this week of the Senate’s search for consensus on gun control after the Newtown shooting can be traced to timing, convoluted rules and a counterproductive alliance.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Jeff Flake of Arizona was in an empty hallway in the Capitol on Tuesday when he bumped into Gabrielle Giffords, the former Democratic member of Congress from his home state who was critically wounded in a mass shooting. Both froze in anticipation of the painful minute about to unfold.

articles.headline: Wall St. Redux: Arcane Names Hiding Big Risk
articles.snippet: Investments that were vulnerable in the last financial crisis and believed to be gone for good have largely escaped new rules that were made to prevent another crisis.
articles.abstract: Investments that were vulnerable in the last financial crisis and believed to be gone for good have largely escaped new rules that were made to prevent another crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: The alchemists of Wall Street are at it again.

articles.headline: 2nd Bombing Suspect Caught After Frenzied Hunt Paralyzes Boston
articles.snippet: The teenage suspect in the Boston Marathon bombings, Dzhokhar A. Tsarnaev, was taken into custody in Watertown, Mass., after a search that left his brother dead and the Boston area virtually shut down.
articles.abstract: The teenage suspect in the Boston Marathon bombings, Dzhokhar A. Tsarnaev, was taken into custody in Watertown, Mass., after a search that left his brother dead and the Boston area virtually shut down.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — The teenage suspect in the Boston Marathon bombings, whose flight from the police after a furious gunfight overnight prompted an intense manhunt that virtually shut down the Boston area all day, was taken into custody Friday night after the police found him in nearby Watertown, Mass., officials said.
articles.byline: By Katharine Q. Seelye, William K. Rashbaum and Michael Cooper

articles.headline: Companies Substitute Tangibles, Like Cheese, for Investments
articles.snippet: Moving physical assets into pension plans allows companies to avoid having to come up with the cash they would otherwise need to keep their plans flush.
articles.abstract: Moving physical assets into pension plans allows companies to avoid having to come up with the cash they would otherwise need to keep their plans flush.
articles.lead_paragraph: When is Cheddar more than cheese, or water more than wet?
articles.byline: By Mary Williams Walsh and Julia Werdigier

articles.headline: Eerie Stillness at the Center of a Frenzied Crime Scene
articles.snippet: The hub of the universe, as Boston’s popular nickname would have it, was on lockdown from first light until near dark on Friday.
articles.abstract: The hub of the universe, as Boston’s popular nickname would have it, was on lockdown from first light until near dark on Friday.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — The scene was extraordinary. The hub of the universe, as Boston’s popular nickname would have it, was on lockdown from first light until near dark on Friday. A vast dragnet for one man had brought a major American city to a standstill.

articles.headline: Boy at Home in U.S., Swayed by One Who Wasn’t
articles.snippet: Life as an immigrant seemed easy for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev. For his older brother, Tamerlan, also a suspect in the bombings and now dead, it seemed more fraught.
articles.abstract: Life as an immigrant seemed easy for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev. For his older brother, Tamerlan, also a suspect in the bombings and now dead, it seemed more fraught.
articles.lead_paragraph: One was a boxer, one a wrestler. One favored alligator shoes and fancy shirts, the other wore jeans, button-ups and T-shirts.
articles.byline: By Erica Goode and Serge F. Kovaleski

articles.headline: Antitrust Agreement in Merger of Brewers
articles.snippet: Anheuser-Busch InBev said it had received government approval for for its $20.1 billion deal to buy control of Grupo Modelo, the maker of Corona.
articles.abstract: Anheuser-Busch InBev said it had received government approval for for its $20.1 billion deal to buy control of Grupo Modelo, the maker of Corona.
